Title: VO₂ Max Performance Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: VO₂ max is one of the strongest functional biomarkers of healthspan and cardiovascular fitness. Low VO₂ max is associated with increased all-cause mortality.

What it is: A gold-standard assessment of aerobic fitness using breath-by-breath analysis during graded exercise.

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist / Exercise Physiologist

Title: Submaximal Cardiorespiratory Fitness Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: A safe, lower-intensity way to estimate cardiovascular fitness without reaching maximal exertion.

What it is: Submaximal cycle or treadmill protocol to estimate aerobic capacity using heart rate response.

Duration: 45 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Resting 12-Lead ECG Screening
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: A simple, non-invasive way to detect arrhythmias, conduction abnormalities, or early signs of heart disease.

What it is: A standard 12-lead electrocardiogram performed at rest with clinical interpretation.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Nurse / Kinesiologist (interpreted by Physician)

Title: Exercise ECG Stress Test
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Evaluates heart rhythm and blood pressure response during exercise to detect ischemia or exercise-induced arrhythmias.

What it is: Graded treadmill or cycle test with continuous ECG and blood pressure monitoring.

Duration: 45 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist (interpreted by Physician)

Title: Body Composition Analysis
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Muscle mass, fat distribution, and visceral fat are independent predictors of metabolic and cardiovascular health.

What it is: Bioelectrical impedance analysis (InBody) to measure segmental lean mass, fat mass, and body water.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Resting Metabolic Rate Test
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Knowing your RMR helps optimize nutrition, weight management, and metabolic health strategies.

What it is: Indirect calorimetry to measure oxygen consumption at rest and calculate daily caloric needs.

Duration: 30 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Metabolic Flexibility Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Metabolic flexibility—your ability to switch between fuel sources—is linked to insulin sensitivity and metabolic health.

What it is: Combines RMR with exercise-based substrate utilization testing to assess fat vs. carbohydrate oxidation.

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: VR Vision Performance Screening
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Visual function affects balance, reaction time, driving safety, and cognitive performance.

What it is: VR-based assessment of contrast sensitivity, peripheral vision, and eye-tracking performance.

Duration: 20 minutes | Delivered by Technician

Title: Hearing Screening
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Untreated hearing loss is associated with cognitive decline, social isolation, and reduced quality of life.

What it is: Pure-tone audiometry to assess hearing thresholds across key frequencies.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Technician

Title: Reaction Time & Cognitive Response Test
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Reaction time reflects processing speed and neurological function—key markers of brain health.

What it is: Computer-based assessment of simple and choice reaction time with cognitive load.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Technician

Title: Balance & Proprioception Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Fall risk increases with age; balance and proprioception are trainable and protective.

What it is: Static and dynamic balance testing with eyes open/closed and perturbation challenges.

Duration: 20 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Grip Strength Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Grip strength is a powerful predictor of all-cause mortality, cardiovascular events, and functional independence.

What it is: Standardized dynamometry with normative comparison.

Duration: 10 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Lower Limb Power Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Leg power predicts mobility, independence, and fall risk—especially as we age.

What it is: Vertical jump or leg press power testing with normative comparison.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Functional Movement Screen (FMS)
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Movement asymmetries and limitations increase injury risk and reduce performance.

What it is: Standardized 7-movement screen to identify mobility and stability deficits.

Duration: 30 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: RunEasi Gait & Movement Analysis
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Gait abnormalities can signal neurological, musculoskeletal, or balance issues.

What it is: Wearable sensor-based running/walking gait analysis with biomechanical feedback.

Duration: 30 minutes | Delivered by Kinesiologist

Title: Blood Pressure & Vascular Screening
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Hypertension is the leading modifiable risk factor for cardiovascular disease and stroke.

What it is: Resting BP, orthostatic BP, and pulse wave analysis.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Nurse

Title: Heart Rate Variability (HRV) Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: HRV reflects autonomic nervous system function and stress resilience.

What it is: 5-minute resting HRV capture with time and frequency domain analysis.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Technician
Tags: hrv, heart rate variability, autonomic, stress

Title: Ankle-Brachial Pressure Index (ABI)
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: ABI detects peripheral artery disease, a marker of systemic atherosclerosis.

What it is: Non-invasive BP measurement at arm and ankle to calculate ABI ratio.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Nurse

Title: Spirometry & Lung Age Assessment
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Early detection of obstructive or restrictive lung disease can guide prevention and treatment.

What it is: Standard spirometry with FEV1, FVC, and lung age calculation.

Duration: 15 minutes | Delivered by Nurse / Technician

Title: Blood Testing Coordination Service
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Comprehensive bloodwork is the foundation of preventive medicine and longevity assessment.

What it is: Requisition, coordination, and results integration for third-party lab testing.

Duration: Coordination service | Lab visit at partner facility

Title: Digital Longevity Snapshot – Clinician Review
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: A structured review of your health data by a trained clinician to identify trends and risks.

What it is: 60-minute virtual consultation with a clinician to review uploaded health data, wearables, and questionnaires.

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Clinician (RN / NP)

Title: Digital Longevity Snapshot – Physician Consultation
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: A comprehensive physician-led review of your health status with personalized recommendations.

What it is: 60-minute virtual consultation with a physician to review health data, discuss findings, and create an action plan.

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Physician

Title: Digital Cognitive Screening
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Early detection of cognitive changes enables proactive intervention and lifestyle modification.

What it is: Validated online cognitive assessment battery with clinician interpretation.

Duration: 45 minutes (self-administered) + 15-minute review | Delivered by Clinician

Title: Psychiatric Mental Health Screening (Online)
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Mental health is foundational to longevity—screening enables early intervention.

What it is: Standardized screening questionnaires with virtual clinician review and recommendations.

Duration: 30 minutes | Delivered by Clinician (RN-Psych / NP)

Title: Psychiatric Mental Health Screening (In-Person)
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: In-person assessment allows for deeper clinical evaluation and therapeutic rapport.

What it is: Comprehensive in-person psychiatric screening with clinical interview.

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Clinician (RN-Psych / NP)

Title: Genetic Panel – Nutrigenetics
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Genetic variants influence how you metabolize nutrients, caffeine, alcohol, and medications.

What it is: DNA test analyzing nutrient metabolism, food sensitivities, and dietary response genes.

Duration: Kit provided at clinic | Results in 3-4 weeks | Delivered by Clinician

Title: Genetic Panel – Cancer Genetics
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Hereditary cancer syndromes can be identified early, enabling proactive screening and prevention.

What it is: Multigene panel testing for hereditary cancer risk (e.g., BRCA1/2, Lynch syndrome).

Duration: Kit provided at clinic | Results in 3-4 weeks | Delivered by Physician

Title: Genetic Panel – Longevity & Health
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Understanding your genetic predispositions empowers personalized health optimization.

What it is: Comprehensive DNA panel covering cardiovascular, metabolic, neurological, and longevity-related genes.

Duration: Kit provided at clinic | Results in 3-4 weeks | Delivered by Physician

Title: Limited Screening Ultrasound
Body (HTML):
Why it matters: Non-invasive imaging can detect structural abnormalities, aneurysms, or organ pathology early.

What it is: Focused ultrasound examination of a single region (e.g., thyroid, carotid, abdominal aorta).

Duration: 30 minutes | Delivered by Sonographer (interpreted by Physician)

Title: Physician Concierge Assessment
Body (HTML):
Your Recommended First Step

A one-on-one consultation with Dr. James French to design a personalized health and longevity roadmap tailored to your unique goals, medical history, and lifestyle.

What you'll receive:

  • 60-minute physician consultation (virtual or in-person)
  • Comprehensive health history review
  • Personalized assessment recommendations
  • Custom longevity roadmap
  • Priority scheduling for follow-up services

Duration: 60 minutes | Delivered by Dr. James French, Physician
